conclusion: Analyze the graph where the reciprocal of velocity is plotted against displacement.
The graph shows 1/v on the y-axis and x on the x-axis; as x increases, 1/v increases linearly.
Since 1/v increases with x, v decreases with x.
The positive slope indicates that 1/v is increasing, meaning v is decreasing.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
If velocity is decreasing, the particle is decelerating.
Since v is decreasing as x increases, the particle is decelerating.
